Thanks for checking out my properties!

My name is Dawn and I have been living in beautiful historical Charlestown for the last 16 years. My property is near and dear to my heart as this was my grandparents home that I pretty much grew up in and that I bought after they passed away. I recently decided to turn my beautiful peice of property into a place where visitors can come and enjoy all this wonderful city has to offer while staying in a place of history vs a hotel!  You will enjoy staying here and all this city has to offer_ I will make sure of it!  :)
Thank you and I look forward to meeting you!

column2: MA|"I am a friendly and fun women in my 60's. I am very active and LOVE hosting especially international people

column1: I have hosted with other groups for over 20 years!
I enjoy showing people around town and even weekend trips if available.
My house is in a great neighborhood close to great shops and restaurants and very close to transportation(2 minutes)
column2: medical centers (15 minutes)and down town (20 minutes)

column1: Jamaica Plain is a very diverse
column2: eclectic and ""hip"" area of Boston yet only 20 minutes on the bus to downtown.

column1: If you prefer to stay close to home there are running trails
column3: the Arboretum and some great little restaurants within walking distance. I have a private and landscaped back yard for you to relax in along with a back and front porch.  There is ample on street parking.

column1: I keep a quiet house and am fairly busy so you will have alot of privacy .
You are welcomed to use the kitchen. Laundry available also. Your room is private with a large window
column2: desk and plenty of room for clothes etc

column1: You will have a great Boston experience
I look forward to hearing from you!

column3: and listed our newly renovated ""Beautiful Boston Brownstone"" in August 2016. We also just launched both Boston units together for larger parties - ""Luxury Brownstone Penthouse Duplex""!

column1: I have been successfully renting the Cape Cod home for over 15 years and was a landlord before we converted to condos here in Boston 10 years prior to that.
I promise you I am extremely accommodating to all of my guests. I make sure everything is perfect on arrival and I am accessible whenever needed. In fact
column2: we received Superhost status every single quarter since we began (we have more than 170 5 star reviews)!

column1: I am recently retired after a 35 year career in advertising
column2: and am now a full time host! I am married to David
column5: and we have a wonderful daughter
column7: who graduated from Northwestern University and is now thriving in NYC.

column1: I am enjoying meeting new and interesting people from around the world through Airbnb and making sure I provide the highest quality experience possible for all of my guests.
Thank you for taking the time to view my listings and hope to hear from you!

column2: MA|"I manage a number of furnished units around Boston and Brookline with my business partner Joseph Morrissey.  I am a Realtor with Unlimited Sotheby's  and do sales/rentals in the greater Boston market.  I also manage a sculpture school/studio with my husband
column3: sculptor Morris Norvin.  Stonybrook Fine Arts
column4: is located in the Boston neighborhood Jamaica Plain across the street from the famous Sam Adams Brewery.  We offer a variety of one day workshops on our calendar including welding
column5: jewelry and metal casting.   Longer classes are available and meet one time each week including the options above as well as mold making
column6: live figure modeling and foundry.  Custom workshops are available for small groups
column10: create an engagement ring and team building.  We are happy to arrange a tour of Sam Adams after a daytime workshop not occurring on Sunday.  Contact us for more details to set up your custom event!

column1: GENERAL FAQ for guests before booking
FAQ: What are Airbnb Service Fees?
FAQ: For How to make a payment / reservation
Please message me first before you book with the number of guests including kids. Tax of 13% is added on to the total and sent.
FAQ: For How to Contact Airbnb Support
FAQ: How and when do I make a payment for my reservation?
FAQ: How can I view or print a billing receipt or itinerary for my trip?
FAQ: How are cleaning fees added?
FAQ: How does the Airbnb payment system work?
Contact Number and Email Information will only be released until a booking is made.
Below is the FAQ on airbnb “Why can’t I call or email a host before booking?”: www.airbnb.com/help/question/111
We strongly recommend reviewing all cancellation policies before making your reservations: www.airbnb.com/home/cancellation_policies
Hope this helps you get to know how airbnb works :-)

column4: check out date and total number of guests. The system will auto generate the price for your consideration. Regarding the currency display

column6: you can change your currency setting at the lower left panel of your airbnb page under the ""LANGUAGE""
column7: you will see ""CURRENCY"" setting. Just click on it to change to any currency that you wish to display.

column1: My guests have access to the very best restaurants
column4: pastry shops and Italian import stores in all of Boston and they are steps from Girasole.  Many Italians have names for their homes to make their sense of arrival and time spent there more enjoyable. Girasole is the Italian word for “Sunflower” but the literal meaning of Girasole in Italian is “turns to the sun.” It is my pleasure as your host to turn you toward what are the brightest
column6: and most Italian of experiences that are available in Boston’s Little Italy. Inside Girasole there is a list for you to make your wandering around the neighborhood more purposeful so that you can run into the best life has to offer during your stay.

MA|I'm a local community activist and have been living in Boston almost all my life. MA|I’m a musician. I was born in Poland but I have been living in Boston for the last 25 years. I travelled extensively all over Europe and some other places around the world. My favorite destinations include Southern France

column1: I am an avid user of the AirBnB platform as both a host and a guest and am very glad to be part of this awesome community.

column2: I focus on treating guests the way I would like to be treated!  A lot of time and effort is spent to ensure the house is well decorated and clean
column3: bed sheets and towels are washed and ironed
column4: and all the basic necessities are available so that guests feel as if they have found a home away from home!

column1: When I am not hosting guests from around the world in Boston
column2: I go out and explore the world and stay in AirBnB properties regularly.  I treat my host homes as I would my own and am always happy to talk and get to know my hosts and their recommendations!

column1: Thank you for being part of this community and reading my profile.
I wish you safe and happy travels!

column3: hard working person who is always motivated to learn new things and new places. I am a man of faith and respect people's beliefs (actually
column4: it's very interesting to share our beliefs and learning from each other!)

column1: Family and friends are very important to me so I always plan some type of activity to meet them on a regular basis (don't worry
column2: we do outside activities). I also love sports and dancing! Basketball is my favorite so if you'd like to play or dance we can plan on it. My place is a shared place however
column3: each person has their own private space in all common areas. column3: and listed our newly renovated ""Beautiful Boston Brownstone"" in August 2016. We also just launched both Boston units together for larger parties - ""Luxury Brownstone Penthouse Duplex""!

column1: I have been successfully renting the Cape Cod home for over 15 years and was a landlord before we converted to condos here in Boston 10 years prior to that.
I promise you I am extremely accommodating to all of my guests. I make sure everything is perfect on arrival and I am accessible whenever needed. In fact
column2: we received Superhost status every single quarter since we began (we have more than 170 5 star reviews)!

column1: I am recently retired after a 35 year career in advertising
column2: and am now a full time host! I am married to David
column5: and we have a wonderful daughter
column7: who graduated from Northwestern University and is now thriving in NYC.

column1: I am enjoying meeting new and interesting people from around the world through Airbnb and making sure I provide the highest quality experience possible for all of my guests.
Thank you for taking the time to view my listings and hope to hear from you!

column2: NV|"I've had the pleasure of hosting hundreds of guests at my Airbnb listings
column3: and have been a guest myself at a number of Airbnb properties around the world. I'm very familiar with the properties I've listed
column4: so no question will go unanswered. As a guest
column5: I have stayed in bargain Airbnbs with the absolute bare minimum of furnishings. They feel like understocked prisons! I've tried really hard to do the opposite with my properties
column6: thinking ahead about guest needs and including little touches of home where I can. From vegetable peelers and wine openers
column10: I want you to enjoy a luxurious experience.

column1: I'm a traveler at heart (50+ countries and counting!)

column1: I have been renting my apartments for decades
column3: I know how important it is to make your stay easy and comfortable. Your accommodations are exactly as advertised. The amenities are as luxurious as our former wonderful guests specify. The apartment is short term rental specifically designed for your total comfort. As our guests mentioned ""The pictures don’t do it any justice.""

column1: My husband Alex and I take the feedback we have gotten from our initial guests very seriously
column2: and have implemented all suggestions to improve the apartment and the experience…. Even though all of our reviews are very positive
column3: we strive to always improve ourselves and our apartments.

column2: we will be as involved with your trip as much as you want. If you would like to get recommendations as to where to go
column4: and places to eat we will most certainly help you with that
column5: but if you rather be left alone
column6: we will let you enjoy your privacy of your own apartment while visiting Boston.

column1: Enjoy your visit to Boston and when you are finished with your day of tourism or work
column2: you can return to your rental home. REST and RELAX in a clean and well-appointed apartment. The goal is that you have a worry free and comfortable stay.

column1: We are Boris and Susan - a young
I (Boris) is originally from Lithuania and Susan is from China - and we've been living in Boston for the last 6+ years.
I'm an entrepreneur and an avid traveler. My work focuses on startups and the transportation sector. In the past
column2: I've been a part of the first person-to-person carsharing startup that helped people share their cars with neighbors (think Airbnb + Zipcar). After that
column3: I have founded - and currently run - an electric bike company called EVELO that makes it easier for people to get around wherever they live.

column1: Susan works as a marketing professional at a larger company and is a huge photography buff. Many of the photos you'll see in our apartment are the ones done by her in our travels.
We both love to travel ourselves and try to stay at Airbnb wherever we go. Over the last few years
column6: and Asia - as much as possible we love to incorporate travel in our lifestyle.

column1: We wanted to share our apartment with Airbnb guests as a way to pay back the incredibly hospitality and experiences we've encountered ourselves during our travels. We know what it's like to come to a new place for the first time and our goal is to provide you with a wonderful
column2: cozy and unique place to stay and advice and feedback that you would expect from a friend.

column1: We're a young (very young) and fun loving couple currently living
column2: working and enjoying this great city of Boston.

column1: We are both originally from the lone star state
column2: but met and got married in Shanghai just before repatriating back to the U.S. It’s a very long story!

column5: and travel.  We are always thinking
column6: planning and dreaming of new adventures close and afar.  And anywhere we travel
column7: we usually seek out the latest culinary experience or seeking that perfectly balanced cocktail.

column2: we both absolutely love to host!  We believe that hospitality is truly an acquired art form for making others feel welcome
column4: and feel at home.  We believe that it is the talent for spreading warmth and kindness that will be remembered always!

column1: We are committed on making your stay with us an unforgettable EXPERIENCE!
We have both lived abroad for a great part of our lives.  Nayeli spent time in Africa and went to school in France before moving to Asia.  I
column2: on the other hand -  spent time in Europe before moving to Beijing in 2000 to continue with my professional career.

column1: We both had great experiences traveling in Asia
column2: and we felt compelled to return back to the Americas and try to replicate the same adventures here at home.

column1: We really look forward to hosting you soon!

column2: MA|My family and I are from the Boston area. We love to travel and spend time with friends and family. We have a creative spirit and love real estate
MA|"I want to welcome you to  Boston and wish you an enjoyable stay.  Boston is a wonderful exciting city. Enjoy its Theaters
column3: restaurants and all that it has to offer.  Boston is like a charming European city . Enjoy the  beautiful architecture of the city. You will be in the area  called Bay Village
column4: that dates back to the 1840.See the home of Edger Allen Poe on Fayette St. and the site of the Coconut Grove fire on Piedmont St. See the Swan boats at the  Boston Public Garden
column5: only a few blocks away. The Boston  home you are staying in was once the Paramount News building
column6: where news reels were edited and then sent to movie theaters around the area. A plaque hangs in front of the building ""Paramount News
column7: Eyes and Ears of the World"". The brick wall of the deck

column1: Thanks for checking out my properties!

My name is Dawn and I have been living in beautiful historical Charlestown for the last 16 years. My property is near and dear to my heart as this was my grandparents home that I pretty much grew up in and that I bought after they passed away. I recently decided to turn my beautiful peice of property into a place where visitors can come and enjoy all this wonderful city has to offer while staying in a place of history vs a hotel!  You will enjoy staying here and all this city has to offer_ I will make sure of it!  :)
Thank you and I look forward to meeting you!

I started on Airbnb with ""Gorgeous Cape Cod"" property in May 2015
column2: listed our renovated ""Stunning South End Back Bay Penthouse"" in August 2015
column3: and listed our newly renovated ""Beautiful Boston Brownstone"" in August 2016. We also just launched both Boston units together for larger parties - ""Luxury Brownstone Penthouse Duplex""!

column1: I have been successfully renting the Cape Cod home for over 15 years and was a landlord before we converted to condos here in Boston 10 years prior to that.
I promise you I am extremely accommodating to all of my guests. I make sure everything is perfect on arrival and I am accessible whenever needed. In fact
column2: we received Superhost status every single quarter since we began (we have more than 170 5 star reviews)!

column1: I am recently retired after a 35 year career in advertising
column2: and am now a full time host! I am married to David
column5: and we have a wonderful daughter
column7: who graduated from Northwestern University and is now thriving in NYC.

column1: I am enjoying meeting new and interesting people from around the world through Airbnb and making sure I provide the highest quality experience possible for all of my guests.
Thank you for taking the time to view my listings and hope to hear from you!

column1: I have been renting my apartments for decades
column3: I know how important it is to make your stay easy and comfortable. Your accommodations are exactly as advertised. The amenities are as luxurious as our former wonderful guests specify. The apartment is short term rental specifically designed for your total comfort. As our guests mentioned ""The pictures don’t do it any justice.""

column1: My husband Alex and I take the feedback we have gotten from our initial guests very seriously
column2: and have implemented all suggestions to improve the apartment and the experience…. Even though all of our reviews are very positive
column3: we strive to always improve ourselves and our apartments.

column2: we will be as involved with your trip as much as you want. If you would like to get recommendations as to where to go
column4: and places to eat we will most certainly help you with that
column5: but if you rather be left alone
column6: we will let you enjoy your privacy of your own apartment while visiting Boston.

column1: Enjoy your visit to Boston and when you are finished with your day of tourism or work
column2: you can return to your rental home. REST and RELAX in a clean and well-appointed apartment. The goal is that you have a worry free and comfortable stay.

We are Airbnb Queen! We started hosting a few apartments in 2015 and grew to be a small company with a love for hosting and giving back to our community!

column2: we were at a standstill! We had to quickly learn and grow to make sure our health and cleaning standards were in line with those of the CDC. We remain dedicated to providing a happy and healthy stay for our amazing guests!

column1: We are partnered with a wonderful non-profit that specializes in providing  housing for families in need of a discounted or free place to stay for the duration of their hospital visits. Most of these stays are for children under going treatment in our amazing Boston Hospitals. We are honored and motivated to helping those in need. If you are here for a hospital related visit
column2: please let us know prior to booking!

column1: We hope we get the chance to host you!"|within an hour|100%|100%|t|https://a0.muscache.com/im/pictures/user/54d65dcc-901b-4d06-a6d1-85a5c1d8164f.jpg?aki_policy=profile_small|https://a0.muscache.com/im/pictures/user/54d65dcc-901b-4d06-a6d1-85a5c1d8164f.jpg?aki_policy=profile_x_medium|Back Bay West|107|187|['email'

column2: MA|"Welcome to our Home!  Great for a staycation
column4: and/or friends/families. We’re top rated in cleaning and you will feel comfortable knowing that due to this pandemic
column5: we are taking extra care to disinfect and sanitize frequently touched surfaces and follow the CDC procedures. No human interaction is needed for check in. We are here to provide and facilitate you in any way to ensure you have the best stay in Boston! Rent the entire condo that has been carefully decorated so that you feel right at home! Our goal is to promote happiness

column2: MA|"I am a young working professional
column3: currently residing in Dedham. I rent out an apartment in my home
column4: as well as co-host for a couple other folks on Airbnb. I love hosting and am moving towards doing it full time.

column1: I feel your experience should feel like home away from home
column2: even if the places you stay are very different from how you live! I pride myself on keeping clean and cozy spaces. My parents run a formal bed and breakfast in Western Mass and I hope to incorporate some of their habits into your stay. I love to hear feedback that would help future guests feel more at home because the little touches are important.
love gardening and spending time with friends and family. I also enjoy traveling and make a point of staying in other Airbnb's wherever I go. I have had the opportunity to stay at places in Austin
column5: Chicago and New York and am hoping to expand that list!

column1: I look forward to meeting new people through this experience and hope you enjoy your stay! column2: we were at a standstill! We had to quickly learn and grow to make sure our health and cleaning standards were in line with those of the CDC. We remain dedicated to providing a happy and healthy stay for our amazing guests!

column1: We are partnered with a wonderful non-profit that specializes in providing  housing for families in need of a discounted or free place to stay for the duration of their hospital visits. We are Airbnb Queen! We started hosting a few apartments in 2015 and grew to be a small company with a love for hosting and giving back to our community!

column2: we were at a standstill! We had to quickly learn and grow to make sure our health and cleaning standards were in line with those of the CDC. We remain dedicated to providing a happy and healthy stay for our amazing guests!

column1: We are partnered with a wonderful non-profit that specializes in providing  housing for families in need of a discounted or free place to stay for the duration of their hospital visits. Most of these stays are for children under going treatment in our amazing Boston Hospitals. We are honored and motivated to helping those in need. If you are here for a hospital related visit
column2: please let us know prior to booking!

column2: MA|Thatch is an ever-evolving hospitality management company that specializes in co-living
column3: hotels and apartment-hotels for short and long stays. Founded in 2010
column4: Thatch's goal is to make Boston more accessible by providing innovative housing and hotel concepts at prices and on terms that put the value in hospitality back where it belongs - with the guests. We do this by stripping out non-essential services and amenities - like daily room cleaning and on-site food and beverage - and by centralizing our staff. In exchange
column6: independence and more room in their travel budgets. Simple. Flexible. Functional. column2: MA|"I am a retired educator.  I like to refer to myself as a retired elementary teacher although I spent the last quarter of my career as an administrator.  But my teaching years were my best.  The daily student teacher interaction

column1: I grew up on a very successful produce and dairy farm in Southeastern Massachusetts.  Our main cash crop was tomatoes but we raised all kinds of vegetables.  They were trucked into Boston.  In the winter the dairy supported us.  My childhood exposed me to hard work but also to a love for the outdoors and nature.
Out of college I worked for the Department of Defense as a teacher in their overseas dependents' schools.  I taught in Istanbul and Seville
column2: Spain.  I was able to travel extensively through Europe for three years.

column1: Upon returning to the States I began teaching in Quincy
column3: where I remained for thirty years.  The last seven years were spent as a principal of an elementary school which has a majority population of Asian students.  I traveled to China one summer to explore my students' heritage and culture.

column1: In the interim I married Joyce Brothers.  Joyce is a case manager for Boston Senior Home Care.  Her passion is cooking and she is a graduate of the Cambridge School of Culinary Arts.
She and I have raised two children.  Our daughter is a school teacher.  Our son
As a life-long learner I am a proponent of travel.  Whether for pleasure or business
column2: travel is the portal to understanding."|within a day|100%|100%|t|https://a0.muscache.com/im/users/35990162/profile_pic/1434500935/original.jpg?aki_policy=profile_small|https://a0.muscache.com/im/users/35990162/profile_pic/1434500935/original.jpg?aki_policy=profile_x_medium|Fenway–Kenmore|1|4|['email'

column1: We are a British couple who live between the UK and the USA. We Airbnb our homes while travelling.

My husband works in finance and I am now retired from a corporate career and we both love to travel.  As our Airbnbs are also our homes they are furnished as a home and not as a rental so there should be everything you need - even for an extended stay.

We love Airbnb both as a host and guest and have stayed in some fabulous properties. Being a host myself I understand how important good guests are and always try and be one myself. I also try and make sure our own properties have everything a guest would want.
We have websites for the properties we rent which we send to you post booking. The website has everything you need to know from things about the property
column6: things to do and local contacts."|within a few hours|100%|78%|t|https://a0.muscache.com/im/users/6428297/profile_pic/1416345440/original.jpg?aki_policy=profile_small|https://a0.muscache.com/im/users/6428297/profile_pic/1416345440/original.jpg?aki_policy=profile_x_medium|Islington|2|3|['email'

column3: and medical tourism agencies to provide housing both short-term and long -term. We also work with Institutions and businesses to make sure that their clients have a comfortable

We are Airbnb Queen! We started hosting a few apartments in 2015 and grew to be a small company with a love for hosting and giving back to our community!

column2: we were at a standstill! We had to quickly learn and grow to make sure our health and cleaning standards were in line with those of the CDC. We remain dedicated to providing a happy and healthy stay for our amazing guests!

column1: We are partnered with a wonderful non-profit that specializes in providing  housing for families in need of a discounted or free place to stay for the duration of their hospital visits. Most of these stays are for children under going treatment in our amazing Boston Hospitals. We are honored and motivated to helping those in need. If you are here for a hospital related visit
column2: please let us know prior to booking!

column1: My name is Albena . I lived in few countries in Europe before settling down in Boston. I love living next to the ocean and the cultural experiences Boston can offer.
I am excited to share my home and town with fellow travelers. I work with people and like interacting with people. I also like art and good coffee.
My house is well suited for long term stays/ remote work . I design my listings like I would for a dear friend who will be living in my house.

I look forward to meeting you and welcoming you to my home. column1: My  name is Andrea. My son
column2: Omar and I co-host our 2nd floor unit throughout the year and occasionally our 1st floor unit.

column1: I am a Registered Nurse working in Home Care.
I would like to invite you to stay at my home in Boston
column2: Airbnb. Guest have the option to stay in private room on the 2nd floor or stay in a 2 bedroom apartment on the 1st floor. You will have access to free WiFi. There are large screen smart TVs for your enjoyment with free internet. There is a laundry area that is available to you 1 day a week
column3: there is a schedule that all guest follow.

column1: The home is walking distance to the bus line (around the corner) and a mile from the train station (the Red line @ Ashmont Station). There is plenty of parking.
Let me know if you have any questions.

column1: 865064682512161383|https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/865064682512161383|20231218233145|2023-12-19|city scrape|https://a0.muscache.com/pictures/prohost-api/Hosting-865064682512161383/original/215d4b32-8017-4732-a0e1-8df8f0b40e77.jpeg|310662379|https://www.airbnb.com/users/show/310662379|Ulrich|2019-11-19||"I graduated college in 2017 with a chemistry degree. During college
column2: I picked up a part time job as a houseman in my school’s hotel
column3: less so for the money. More so to look busy. It was initially meant to be a past time
column4: but one particular night left a mark I never forgot.

column1: The job required me to assist the housekeepers. I was the grease to a well-maintained machine. Take off the bed sheets
column2: remove the used soaps and towels
column3: and empty the trash. You do that to every room. Simple right?

column1: It was the last night for an opposing school’s football team and my manager needed someone to clean up after them and then prepare the rooms for the next working day.
I showed up and cleared every room assigned to me. I thought nothing of it and went back to my dorm. The next day
column2: I went back to work on my regular shift.
everyone came up to me to thank me for making their day a hundred times easier. I was happy for a moment. But then I scratched my head thinking to myself
column3: “you all know that I’m getting paid for this right?”

column1: But then it dawned on me. I was looking at this experience through broken glasses.
Hospitality is as much a human experience for the guests as it is for the people who make that experience worthwhile.
That day has inspired to me to strive to make every experience worthwhile. My goal is to facilitate wonderful experiences for people around the world. Hopefully
column2: hosting on Airbnb will be the catalyst for my guests to make fun

MA|"I'm originally from Spain but I've been in JP for almost 26 years when work and study brought me to Boston.  I love traveling and exploring different cultures.  I also love being outdoors especially riding my bike around town or walking my very friendly small dog
column3: Henri.  He is hypoallergenic and he does not shed.  He lives on the second floor but if you met him you'd want him to visit you.  Henri is adorable and lovable!  He is like a teddy bear.

column1: I'm a food enthusiast concentrating on natural and organic foods but I'm not a purist so I'm flexible and adjust to different situations where organic is not available.  I
column2: must say my favorite food is a slice of good bread dipped in olive oil (of course from Spain lol).

column1: I can offer a warm and comforting atmosphere
column2: a home away from home.   I'd be glad to help you to get around the city
column4: finding bike paths in the city.

column1: I have hosted with Air BnB since 2016 with an hiatus in 2019.  I have 17+ years of hosting in my victorian house through various universities in Boston.  I have hosted for short and  long periods many medical researchers
column6: English learners etc from all over the world.

column1: House is between Green line (MSPCA stop) and Orange Line (Stony Brook).  Ten min walk to Whole Foods.  My  house is 2 miles to Harvard School of Medicine
column3: Northeastern and a bit further but not far the medical campus of Boston University
column4: 10 min T ride from Back Bay where you can find The Arquitectural School and MFA is 2.3 miles away."|within a few hours|100%|77%|t|https://a0.muscache.com/im/pictures/user/User-49565531/original/dc0e22eb-53ff-437a-9858-25751f672848.jpeg?aki_policy=profile_small|https://a0.muscache.com/im/pictures/user/User-49565531/original/dc0e22eb-53ff-437a-9858-25751f672848.jpeg?aki_policy=profile_x_medium|Jamaica Plain|3|4|['email'

column2: we were at a standstill! We had to quickly learn and grow to make sure our health and cleaning standards were in line with those of the CDC. We remain dedicated to providing a happy and healthy stay for our amazing guests!

column1: We are partnered with a wonderful non-profit that specializes in providing  housing for families in need of a discounted or free place to stay for the duration of their hospital visits. Most of these stays are for children under going treatment in our amazing Boston Hospitals. We are honored and motivated to helping those in need. If you are here for a hospital related visit
column2: please let us know prior to booking!

column1: 1020258342394952443|https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/1020258342394952443|20231218233145|2023-12-19|city scrape|https://a0.muscache.com/pictures/miso/Hosting-1020258342394952443/original/4af22e1d-181a-4193-a3ce-50b0808abf1c.jpeg|371640674|https://www.airbnb.com/users/show/371640674|Boston|2020-10-12||"Hello! We are Airbnb Queen! We started hosting a few apartments in 2015 and grew to be a small company with a love for hosting and giving back to our community!

column2: we were at a standstill! We had to quickly learn and grow to make sure our health and cleaning standards were in line with those of the CDC. We remain dedicated to providing a happy and healthy stay for our amazing guests!

column1: We are partnered with a wonderful non-profit that specializes in providing  housing for families in need of a discounted or free place to stay for the duration of their hospital visits. column2: MA|"I live in the Back Bay and I'm happy to accommodate any unique requests.

column1: Our properties are available to business professionals seeking short-term corporate housing and families visiting Boston area hospitals.  Please inquire about our special rates for those associated with Shriners
My large family are all long-time Boston residents
column2: and most of the members still own apartments from when they lived in downtown Boston.  All of my condo's are owned by members of my family.

column1: Prior to my current job at an investment consulting and advisory firm
column2: where I focus on identifying top-tier real estate managers for our clients to invest in
column3: I worked for a small firm managing a Saudi Prince's hotel investments across North America and Europe.  We managed his interests in the Four Seasons and Fairmont
column4: as well as oversaw his investments in several trophy properties
column6: NYC's The Plaza; Paris' Four Seasons Hotel George V; and London's The Savoy.  I have taken the same approach we took at my previous firm to managing our personal real estate investments
column7: by providing exceptional service combined with fantastic accommodations in prime locations.

column1: If you stay with us during the summer months (typically available mid weekdays from the middle of June to Labor Day)
column2: we'd love to take you out on our 50-ft yacht for a complimentary afternoon sail and lunch (catered by a restaurant / bar we own) around the Boston Harbor (schedule and availability permitting and limited to guests 16 years and older).

column1: Also feel free to inquire about special rates on massages at Bodywaves - a business my father runs on Hanover St. in Boston's Quincy Market / Faneuil Hall area."|within an hour|100%|100%|t|https://a0.muscache.com/im/users/9410008/profile_pic/1412389906/original.jpg?aki_policy=profile_small|https://a0.muscache.com/im/users/9410008/profile_pic/1412389906/original.jpg?aki_policy=profile_x_medium|Back Bay|15|46|['email'

column2: MA|"I live in the Back Bay and I'm happy to accommodate any unique requests.

column1: Our properties are available to business professionals seeking short-term corporate housing and families visiting Boston area hospitals.  Please inquire about our special rates for those associated with Shriners
My large family are all long-time Boston residents
column2: and most of the members still own apartments from when they lived in downtown Boston.  All of my condo's are owned by members of my family.

column1: Prior to my current job at an investment consulting and advisory firm
column2: where I focus on identifying top-tier real estate managers for our clients to invest in
column3: I worked for a small firm managing a Saudi Prince's hotel investments across North America and Europe.  We managed his interests in the Four Seasons and Fairmont
column4: as well as oversaw his investments in several trophy properties
column6: NYC's The Plaza; Paris' Four Seasons Hotel George V; and London's The Savoy.  I have taken the same approach we took at my previous firm to managing our personal real estate investments
column7: by providing exceptional service combined with fantastic accommodations in prime locations.

column1: If you stay with us during the summer months (typically available mid weekdays from the middle of June to Labor Day)
column2: we'd love to take you out on our 50-ft yacht for a complimentary afternoon sail and lunch (catered by a restaurant / bar we own) around the Boston Harbor (schedule and availability permitting and limited to guests 16 years and older).

column1: Prior to my current job at an investment consulting and advisory firm

We are Airbnb Queen! We started hosting a few apartments in 2015 and grew to be a small company with a love for hosting and giving back to our community!

column2: we were at a standstill! We had to quickly learn and grow to make sure our health and cleaning standards were in line with those of the CDC. We remain dedicated to providing a happy and healthy stay for our amazing guests!

column1: We are partnered with a wonderful non-profit that specializes in providing  housing for families in need of a discounted or free place to stay for the duration of their hospital visits. Most of these stays are for children under going treatment in our amazing Boston Hospitals. We are honored and motivated to helping those in need. If you are here for a hospital related visit
column2: please let us know prior to booking!
